issues.title: remove boost dependency
issues.body: would be nice not having to pull in that monster

commit.message: update AUTHORS file
Merge branch 'master' into staging

device: add max_threads_per_multi_processor() member

Adds a new member function that can be used to query the
maximum number of resident threads per multiprocessor for
cuda runtime >= 4.0

Fix warnings for GCC 7 about minor and major macro definitions.

Fixes the following warning when using GCC 7:

 Warning: In the GNU C Library, "minor" is defined
 by <sys/sysmacros.h>. For historical compatibility, it is
 currently defined by <sys/types.h> as well, but we plan to
 remove this soon. To use "minor", include <sys/sysmacros.h>
 directly. If you did not intend to use a system-defined macro
 "minor", you should undefine it after including <sys/types.h>.
         unsigned int minor() const

This commit undefines the macros major and minor in device.hpp
if they are defined.

function: optional variable shared memory function in cuda::function

The constructor of cuda::function now optionally takes a unary
function as second argument that is used to calculate the shared
memory requirement of the kernel for a given block size.

This function is used to calculate the maximal block size for
optimal device occupancy.

function: query max block size and min grid size for optimal occupancy

Upon construction of a cuda::function wrapper the maximal block size
and minimal grid size for optimal occupancy are queried and stored.

This is only supported for cuda >= 6.5; for older cuda versions both
values default to 0.

release cuda_wrapper under the terms of the 3-clause BSD license

All contributors have agreed to this change of the license, see
https://github.com/halmd-org/cuda-wrapper/issues/1

re-implementation of cuda::allocator

The re-implementation has become necessary to avoid issues with the
upcoming change of license. The template for how to write a custom STL
allocator is textbook knowledge.

Revert "Merge branch 'testing'"

The branch name 'testing' was misleading. The merge was premature and
breaks the use of cuda_wrapper in HALMD, at least on devices of compute
capability less than 2.0 (pre-Fermi). (Yet, commit facd758 suggests that
there is a work-around for such devices.)

Nevertheless, mapped page-locked memory seems to be an interesting
performance-relevant feature, which deserves further investigations.

This reverts commit fa47d2c30694fee7612a80c352c8f706a303d129, reversing
changes made to c9263c89b32ee61e5a388ff93eeb7cc239c76ea1.

To include the reverted commits downstream, revert this commit before
merging:
https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/howto/revert-a-faulty-merge.txt

Merge branch 'testing'

* testing:
  host::vector test: purge mapped_host_memory_pure
  host::vector: fix allocation flags
  test mapping of host memory by direct CUDA calls
  add test for device-mapping of page-locked host memory
make random_access_iterator c++03 compatible

compatibility with ≥ Boost 1.57.0

Since Boost 1.57.0, iterator operators are conditionally defined based
on the iterator category. This is tested by boost::is_convertible of
iterator_category of the random_access_iterator defined in
cuda_wrapper/detail/random_access_iterator.hpp.
As cuda::device_random_access_iterator_tag does not derive from
any iterator tag, the device iterator is not detected as random
access and therefore all random access operators (e.g. operator-) are
hidden.

Fix this by adding a manual specialization of boost::is_convertible
from cuda::device_random_access_iterator_tag to
std::random_access_iterator_tag.

This causes a inconsistency between std::is_convertible and the
boost::is_convertible, given that they now return different values.

Alternatively, one would have to write an own iterator_adaptor.

Fix FTBS for nvcc

Introduced in fa89a2a087b64 and was unnoticed during testing

texture.hpp: CUDA 6.0 compatibility

Otherwise CUDA ≥ 6.0 will fail with "invalid channel descriptor"

Closes #394938

disable Clang ≤ 3.3 warning: unneeded internal declaration

This is a follow-up to commit:6914b42.

host::vector test: purge mapped_host_memory_pure

The test case was useful to point out a problem in the allocation of
host::vector and is not needed anymore.

host::vector: fix allocation flags

cudaHostMalloc() needs to be called with the flag cudaHostAllocMapped,
otherwise calling cudaHostGetDevicePointer() fails.

We should check whether this flag impacts the performance and whether there are
use cases of host::vector where the default mode is preferred.

test mapping of host memory by direct CUDA calls

The device mapping of host memory works also with the Tesla C1060 if we make
use of direct calls to the CUDA library. This points at a problem in
cuda_wrapper.
add test for device-mapping of page-locked host memory

texture: replace private reference by pointer

A default initialisation of a reference is not possible without
potentially dangling objects. (Clang ≥ 3.3 and GCC ≥ 4.8 complain about
this.) The use of pointers is semantically equivalent and safer.

cuda_wrapper: disable warning for CUDA 5.5 headers

Clang ≥ 3.3 emits a warning for CUDA 5.5 headers:

    /usr/local/cuda-5.5/include/cuda_runtime.h:225:33: warning: function
    'cudaMallocHost' is not needed and will not be emitted
    [-Wunneeded-internal-declaration]

Add methods gbegin() and gend() to page-locked host memory vector

This is needed for backwards-compatibility with devices of compute
capability 1.1 or lower. Devices of compute capability support
unified addressing, i.e. a pointer to page-locked host memory
is usable both on the device and the host.

Do not derive cuda::device_random_access_iterator_tag from std::random_access_iterator_tag

This avoids breaking host algorithms that do not and should not
check that the category of an iterator is not convertible to
cuda::device_random_access_iterator_tag.

Move device/host iterator categories to cuda namespace.

The iterator categories are useful for library users as well.

Ensure matching value types in cuda::copy

Compare std::iterator_traits<Iterator>::value_type for equality.

Implement cuda::copy for device and host memory iterators

Support iterators as arguments to cuda::copy. The iterator type is
automatically detected as device or host memory. Therefore any random
access iterator is supported as a host memory iterator, including
std::vector and raw pointers.

Add unit test for cuda::copy with host and/or device memory iterators.

Add cuda::memset for device memory iterators with unit test.
Deprecate cuda::copy for device and host memory containers

Add methods begin() and end() to cuda::vector

Define pointer type as iterator for compatibility with STL containers.

Remove deprecated wrappers for CUDA driver API

Manual context creation was needed as a work around with nvlock < 1011490.

http://git.colberg.org/nvcuda-tools.git/

Substitute cuDriverGetVersion with cudaDriverGetVersion

The latter is available since CUDA version 2.2.

Support CUDA function attributes in CUDA ≥ 4.1

CUDA 4.1 introduced a function cudaFuncGetAttributes() to retrieve
Attributes of a device kernel, e.g. the maximum number of threads
Supported by the function and the current device

The CUDA driver API has had a similar function cuFuncGetAttribute()
Since CUDA 2.2, however this function requires a parameter of type
CUfunction, which the CUDA runtime API does not seem to provide

Only override texture channel format for texture<void, …>

For this purpose, add an explicit constructor for texture<void, …>

Fix cast warning in cuda::function with GCC -pedantic

Include/cuda_wrapper/function.hpp:164:13: warning: ISO C++ forbids casting between pointer-to-function and pointer-to-object [enabled by default]

Increase maximum number of kernel arguments to 16

As we are gradually shifting from use of module-level constants to
Function-level arguments, the number of kernel arguments increases
Adopt consistent space-saving namespace syntax style

Remove __DEVICE_EMULATION__ guard

CUDA device emulation was removed in CUDA 3.1

Fix FTBFS with CUDA 3.2

The API changes in CUDA 3.2 are not documented in the release notes

Cuda_wrapper/driver/mem.hpp: In function ‘unsigned int cuda::driver::mem::total()’:
Cuda_wrapper/driver/mem.hpp:39: error: cannot convert ‘unsigned int*’ to ‘size_t*’ for argument ‘1’ to ‘CUresult cuMemGetInfo_v2(size_t*, size_t*)’
Cuda_wrapper/driver/mem.hpp: In function ‘unsigned int cuda::driver::mem::used()’:
Cuda_wrapper/driver/mem.hpp:49: error: cannot convert ‘unsigned int*’ to ‘size_t*’ for argument ‘1’ to ‘CUresult cuMemGetInfo_v2(size_t*, size_t*)’
Cuda_wrapper/driver/mem.hpp: In function ‘unsigned int cuda::driver::mem::free()’:
Cuda_wrapper/driver/mem.hpp:59: error: cannot convert ‘unsigned int*’ to ‘size_t*’ for argument ‘1’ to ‘CUresult cuMemGetInfo_v2(size_t*, size_t*)’
Simplify dummy GCC 4.4 texture constructor
Remove cruft from cuda::driver::context

Fix GCC 4.4 regression in cuda::texture

This was already fixed in commit de4a997f

Fix missing conversion to symbol type

Fixes corrupted time-step in cuda::copy from double to cuda::symbol<float>

Fix CUDA channel format descriptor for variant textures

With the previous solution, the static cuda::texture object created
Last on program startup would determine the channel descriptor, as
The texture reference exists only once in memory

Revert "Implement cuda::texture following RAII pattern"

As textures are static objects, unbinding is not needed in practice

This reverts commit d667ba924ec2e8cebf4139636baf6d00e89e48fb

Create channel descriptor based on cuda::texture type

Needed for multi-typed textures with union type

Make cuda::texture copyable

This works around a CUDA 3.0/3.1 bug with struct initializers

Nvcc error   : 'cudafe' died due to signal 11 (Invalid memory reference)

Work around CUDA 3.0/3.1 bug with struct initializer

If cuda::symbol is declared noncopyable and the reference to a
 __constant__ variable is assigned using a struct initializer,
Nvcc 3.0/3.1 fails with the following notoriously helpful message:

Nvcc error   : 'cudafe' died due to signal 11 (Invalid memory reference)
Fix invokation of const cuda::symbol
Fix use of const cuda::function

Remove support for kernel function overloading

This was messy, and is not implemented in boost::function either

The same functionality may be achieved with template class members

Fix kernel invokation with CUDA 3.0 and 3.1

The previous implementation of kernel argument setup in
Cuda::function was a bit hackish: cudaSetupArgument was
Called once with a struct containing all arguments
This works fine with CUDA ≤2.3, but breaks with CUDA ≥3.0

Work around broken cudaGetSymbolSize in CUDA ≥3.0

If cudaGetSymbolSize is applied to a C array in CUDA 3.0, it fails
With “unknown error”. In CUDA 3.1, it fails if the definition of
The __constant__ array is enclosed in a namespace, and suceeds
If the array is defined in the global scope

Implement cuda::texture following RAII pattern

On the host side, bind texture in constructor and unbind in destructor

Support any random access host container in cuda::copy

This allows cuda::copy between GPU vectors and Boost uBLAS matrices,
Or specifically the underlying unbounded_array storage. This is only
A temporary solution until we implement CUDA vector iterators
Support type conversion for value to symbol cuda::copy
Avoid zero-size allocation with cudaMalloc
Order #include directives by third-party and native header files

The official project name is… HALMD

HAL’s MD package

Highly Accelerated Large-scale Molecular Dynamics package

In honour of the machine HAL at the Arnold Sommerfeld Center for
Theoretical Physics of the Ludwigs-Maximilians-Universität München

HAL has been the project's first GPGPU machine, equipped initially with
Two GeForce 8800 Ultra. HAL survived a critical air condition failure
And to this day houses two GeForce GTX 280
Support events with flags in CUDA ≥ 2.2
Expand tab characters as 8 spaces
Fix missing const qualifiers in cuda::device::properties

Add bogus cuda::texture constructor to avoid GCC 4.4 compiler warning

    [ 51%] Building CXX object src/ljgpu/CMakeFiles/ljgpu_gpu_neighbour.dir/mdlib.cpp.o
    In file included from /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/include/cuda_wrapper.hpp:60,
		     from /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/sample.hpp:26,
		     from /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/traits.hpp:30,
		     from /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/exception.hpp:25,
		     from /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/base.hpp:29,
		     from /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/hardsphere.hpp:31,
		     from /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdlib.cpp:30:
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/include/cuda_wrapper/texture.hpp: In instantiation of ‘cuda::texture<float4>’:
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/ljfluid_gpu_nbr.hpp:433:   instantiated from ‘void ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, dimension>::threads(unsigned int) [with int dimension = 3]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/mdsim.hpp:148:   instantiated from ‘void ljgpu::mdsim<mdsim_backend>::threads(const boost::true_type&) [with mdsim_backend = ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, 3>]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/mdsim.hpp:284:   instantiated from ‘ljgpu::mdsim<mdsim_backend>::mdsim(const ljgpu::options&) [with mdsim_backend = ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, 3>]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdlib.cpp:111:   instantiated from ‘typename boost::enable_if<typename mdsim_backend::impl_type::impl_gpu, int>::type _mdsim(const ljgpu::options&) [with mdsim_backend = ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, 3>]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdlib.cpp:186:   instantiated from here
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/include/cuda_wrapper/texture.hpp:64: warning: non-static reference ‘const textureReference& cuda::texture<float4>::tex’ in class without a constructor
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/include/cuda_wrapper/texture.hpp: In instantiation of ‘cuda::texture<float2>’:
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/ljfluid_gpu_nbr.hpp:434:   instantiated from ‘void ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, dimension>::threads(unsigned int) [with int dimension = 2]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/mdsim.hpp:148:   instantiated from ‘void ljgpu::mdsim<mdsim_backend>::threads(const boost::true_type&) [with mdsim_backend = ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, 2>]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdsim/mdsim.hpp:284:   instantiated from ‘ljgpu::mdsim<mdsim_backend>::mdsim(const ljgpu::options&) [with mdsim_backend = ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, 2>]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdlib.cpp:111:   instantiated from ‘typename boost::enable_if<typename mdsim_backend::impl_type::impl_gpu, int>::type _mdsim(const ljgpu::options&) [with mdsim_backend = ljgpu::ljfluid<ljgpu::ljfluid_impl_gpu_neighbour, 2>]’
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/src/ljgpu/mdlib.cpp:189:   instantiated from here
    /home/peter/thesis/mdsim/ljgpu/include/cuda_wrapper/texture.hpp:64: warning: non-static reference ‘const textureReference& cuda::texture<float2>::tex’ in class without a constructor
Exclude CUDA driver wrapper in device emulation
Implement floating context using cuCtxPopCurrent and cuCtxPushCurrent
Wrap functions to query CUDA runtime and driver library versions
Implement cuda::driver::context default constructor to attach to current CUDA context
Separate CUDA driver wrapper classes into cuda::driver namespace
Fix "dereferencing type-punned pointer will break strict-aliasing rules" warning
Use canonical CUDA toolkit include path
Fix uninitialized flags in host::allocator copy constructor
Add CUDA driver error strings

Allow passing allocator with optional flags to page-locked host memory vector

Mapping host memory into device memory address space for zero-copy with
CUDA 2.2 by default is a bad idea for NVIDIA® Tesla™ hardware, as the
Device memory address space is limited to 4 GiB, and host memory mapping
Would thus prohibit use of all available device memory
Preserve CUDA vector capacity on resize
Free device memory before reallocation
Support zero-copy in CUDA 2.2
Allow partial memset
Allow partial memcpy
Implement function overloading for varying number of arguments
Separate CUDA driver device memory info from CUDA runtime device properties
Add CUDA context management to set CUDA device within libraries
Add cuda::host::vector construction from range
Revert to simple function argument types to enable deduced type conversion
Enable passing a global device memory pointer to function
Make cuda::event meet CopyConstructible and Assignable requirements of the C++ Standard Library
Make cuda::stream meet CopyConstructible and Assignable requirements of the C++ Standard Library
Query additional device attributes with CUDA 2.0
Add memcpy wrappers between cuda::symbol<T[]> and boost::array
Fix device symbol vector specialisation not to include __constant__ pointers
Query memory info in separate CUDA context
Fix device memory usage query in an unused context
Add C++ wrapper functions for async constant memory update in CUDA 2.0
Add CUDA wrapper function for device memory array memset
Fix CUDA texture wrapper compilation with nvcc
Add swap to CUDA vector and use deep copy constructor and assignment operator
Add shallow copy constructor and assignment operator to CUDA device vector
Add text version of the GNU General Public License (GPL)
Allow wrapping CUDA device functions without arguments
Add C++ wrapper class template for linear CUDA textures
Make CUDA memory deallocators non-throwing
Prevent termination due to exception thrown during stack unwinding after CUDA launch error
Increase maximum number of arguments passed to device functions
Push aligned arguments onto CUDA execution stack with a single call
Enable passing CUDA vector as a device function argument
Return elapsed CUDA time between two events in seconds
Remove CUDA execution preparation from CUDA device function template
Wrap memory info function from CUDA driver API
Return to type-safe CUDA memcpy functions
Remove pointless CUDA vector type translation types

Return unsigned integers for CUDA device properties

Eliminates unnecessary signed-unsigned integer comparison warnings
Add empty initializer to CUDA device properties
Add namespace for CUDA vector translation types
Allow change in capacity without resize of CUDA device vector
Cosmetic change to CUDA vector type templates
Add size assertions to CUDA memcpy functions
Split CUDA device symbol constant and vector into separate templates
Allow CUDA memcpy from or to std::vector
Simplify CUDA vector container API
Add functions to copy between device symbol and value
Unthink cuda_cast function
Add template types for CUDA vector types
Switch source and destination arguments for CUDA memcpy functions
Split out CUDA memcpy functions from container class templates
Add default constructor to CUDA host vector
Add default constructor to CUDA device vector
Use boost preprocessor for arbitrary number of CUDA device function arguments
Add cuda_cast function for global device memory vectors
Use system-wide cuda_runtime.h include path
Revert address-of operator to retrieve pointer to CUDA device memory
Allow initialization of CUDA vectors with execution dimensions

Use size_t for CUDA execution configuration variables

Fixes comparison between signed and unsigned integer expressions warnings
Replace string with std::string for CUDA device identifier

Overload address-of operator to retrieve pointer to CUDA device memory

This shortens argument lists in CUDA device function calls
Add CUDA kernel execution wrappers for senary and septenary device functions
Disable CUDA symbol copy constructor to preclude initialization with self reference
Wrap kernel execution using streams with CUDA_WRAPPER_ASYNC_API macro
Allow use of CUDA streams for kernel execution
Add resize function to CUDA device vector
Allow memcpy between host vectors with different allocator types
Base CUDA device vector on std::vector for automagic allocation
Remove yet another obsolete CUDA C++ API function
Add auto_ptr template class for CUDA global device memory
Merge CUDA kernel execution wrapper headers
Adapt CUDA symbol wrapper template style
Add support for asynchronous CUDA memcpy using streams to C++ API
Split asynchronous CUDA API wrappers into multiple header files
Remove obsolete CUDA C++ API functions
Adapt CUDA vector containers to API changes
Refactor CUDA device symbol vector container
Refactor CUDA device vector container
Refactor CUDA host vector container
Base CUDA host vector on std::vector using a custom allocator
Cleanup CUDA runtime C++ wrapper namespaces and class names
Add C++ wrapper class for CUDA device properties
Inline CUDA thread management functions
Derive CUDA error class from std::exception for easier catches
Add an allocator that wraps cudaMallocHost
Derive an allocator that wraps cudaMalloc from the GNU libstdc++ malloc allocator
Extend cuda::device::symbol class to support device symbol arrays
Omit include directory for compatibility with common installations
Declare array swap functions in a symmetric way to avoid confusion
Omit cudaGetLastError() call while handling CUDA runtime errors
Obey class member initialization order to eliminate warnings
Restructure CUDA runtime wrappers
Abstain from boost preprocessor library in favour of compile time
Use function prototype as template parameter for CUDA kernels
Hide CUDA runtime calls from NVCC compiler
Add missing cudaGetDeviceProperties C++ wrapper function
Replace cudaMemcpy* calls with C++ wrapper functions
Add (incomplete) C++ wrapper for CUDA memory management functions
Move CUDA C++ wrappers into separate subdirectory
Use Boost Library preprocessor to allow arbitrary argument count

Regard data alignment when passing arguments to device functions

All arguments passed to a device function must be aligned with respect
To their alignment requirements

Proper alignment is most easily achieved by aggregating all arguments
In a struct (implemented with template structs union2, union3, union4),
And then, for each argument, using the field offset of the corresponding
Struct member as its offset in the CUDA argument passing area
Add further C++ wrappers for CUDA runtime API
Add C++ wrappers for asynchronous CUDA runtime API
Add preliminary C++ wrapper for CUDA runtime error checking

issue_comments.body:
I agree that my contributions to the cuda-wrapper project until this point of writing are distributed under the terms of the 3-clause BSD license.

Nicolas

I agree that my contributions to the cuda-wrapper project until this point of writing are distributed under the terms of the 3-clause BSD license.

Peter

For completeness:

I agree that my contributions to the cuda-wrapper project until this point of writing are distributed under the terms of the 3-clause BSD license.

Felix

We're using the wrapper mostly in HALMD, and there Boost is needed anyway. Sure, it would be nice to get rid of it. At the same time, it would be nice to switch to C++11, which would simplify some things. But I don't have time to care about such stuff.

Of course, your are welcome to contribute improvements to the package.

commit_comments.body:
putting the enable_if into the template part would give a clean return type
`template <typename InputIterator, typename OutputIterator, typename = std::enable_if_t<....>>`
